uizalivestream.uiza.rtplibrary.base

Class Camera1Base

  • java.lang.Object
    • uizalivestream.uiza.rtplibrary.base.Camera1Base
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GetAacData, GetMicrophoneData, GetCameraData, GetH264Data
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RtmpCamera1, RtspCamera1

    public abstract class Camera1Base
extends java.lang.Object
implements GetAacData, GetCameraData, GetH264Data, GetMicrophoneData
    Wrapper to stream with camera1 api and microphone. Support stream with SurfaceView, TextureView and OpenGlView(Custom SurfaceView that use OpenGl). SurfaceView and TextureView use buffer to buffer encoding mode for H264 and OpenGlView use Surface to buffer mode(This mode is generally better because skip buffer processing).

    API requirements: SurfaceView and TextureView mode: API 16+. OpenGlView: API 18+.

    Created by loitp on 7/07/17.

        Parameters:

      • prepareVideo

        public boolean prepareVideo(int width,
                            int height,
                            int fps,
                            int bitrate,
                            boolean hardwareRotation,
                            int iFrameInterval,
                            int rotation)
        Call this method before use @startStream. If not you will do a stream without video. NOTE: Rotation with encoder is silence ignored in some devices.
        Parameters:
        width - resolution in px.
        height - resolution in px.
        fps - frames per second of the stream.
        bitrate - H264 in kb.
        hardwareRotation - true if you want rotate using encoder, false if you want rotate with software if you are using a SurfaceView or TextureView or with OpenGl if you are using OpenGlView.
        rotation - could be 90, 180, 270 or 0 (Normally 0 if you are streaming in landscape or 90 if you are streaming in Portrait). This only affect to stream result. NOTE: Rotation with encoder is silence ignored in some devices.
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a H264 encoder).

      • prepareVideo

        public boolean prepareVideo(int width,
                            int height,
                            int fps,
                            int bitrate,
                            boolean hardwareRotation,
                            int rotation)
        backward compatibility reason

      • prepareAudioRtp

        protected abstract void prepareAudioRtp(boolean isStereo,
                                        int sampleRate)

      • prepareAudio

        public boolean prepareAudio(int bitrate,
                            int sampleRate,
                            boolean isStereo,
                            boolean echoCanceler,
                            boolean noiseSuppressor)
        Call this method before use @startStream. If not you will do a stream without audio.
        Parameters:
        bitrate - AAC in kb.
        sampleRate - of audio in hz. Can be 8000, 16000, 22500, 32000, 44100.
        isStereo - true if you want Stereo audio (2 audio channels), false if you want Mono audio (1 audio channel).
        echoCanceler - true enable echo canceler, false disable.
        noiseSuppressor - true enable noise suppressor, false disable.
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a AAC encoder).

      • prepareVideo

        public boolean prepareVideo()
        Same to call: rotation = 0; if (Portrait) rotation = 90; prepareVideo(640, 480, 30, 1200 * 1024, false, rotation);
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a H264 encoder).

      • prepareAudio

        public boolean prepareAudio()
        Same to call: prepareAudio(128 * 1024, 44100, true, false, false);
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a AAC encoder).

      • setForce

        public void setForce(CodecUtil.Force forceVideo,
                     CodecUtil.Force forceAudio)
        Parameters:
        forceVideo - force type codec used. FIRST_COMPATIBLE_FOUND, SOFTWARE, HARDWARE
        forceAudio - force type codec used. FIRST_COMPATIBLE_FOUND, SOFTWARE, HARDWARE

      • startRecord

        public void startRecord(java.lang.String path)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Start record a MP4 video. Need be called while stream.
        Parameters:
        path - where file will be saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If you init it before start stream.

      • stopRecord

        public void stopRecord()
        Stop record MP4 video started with @startRecord. If you don't call it file will be unreadable.

      • startPreview

        public void startPreview(int cameraFacing,
                         int width,
                         int height)
        Start camera preview. Ignored, if stream or preview is started.
        Parameters:
        cameraFacing - front ot back camera. Like: Camera.CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_BACK Camera.CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_FRONT
        width - of preview in px.
        height - of preview in px.

      • startPreview

        public void startPreview(int cameraFacing)
        Start camera preview. Ignored, if stream or preview is started. Width and height preview will be the last resolution used to start camera. 640x480 first time.
        Parameters:
        cameraFacing - front ot back camera. Like: Camera.CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_BACK Camera.CameraInfo.CAMERA_FACING_FRONT

      • startPreview

        public void startPreview(int width,
                         int height)
        Start camera preview. Ignored, if stream or preview is started. CameraFacing will be always back.
        Parameters:
        width - preview in px.
        height - preview in px.

      • startPreview

        public void startPreview()
        Start camera preview. Ignored, if stream or preview is started. Width and height preview will be the last resolution used to start camera. 640x480 first time. CameraFacing will be always back.

      • stopPreview

        public void stopPreview()
        Stop camera preview. Ignored if streaming or already stopped. You need call it after @stopStream to release camera properly if you will close activity.

      • setPreviewOrientation

        public void setPreviewOrientation(int orientation)
        Change preview orientation can be called while stream.
        Parameters:
        orientation - of the camera preview. Could be 90, 180, 270 or 0.

      • startStreamRtp

        protected abstract void startStreamRtp(java.lang.String url)

      • startStream

        public void startStream(java.lang.String url)
        Need be called after @prepareVideo or/and @prepareAudio. This method override resolution of @startPreview to resolution seated in @prepareVideo. If you never startPreview this method startPreview for you to resolution seated in @prepareVideo.
        Parameters:
        url - of the stream like: protocol://ip:port/application/streamName

        RTSP: rtsp://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94 RTSPS: rtsps://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94 RTMP: rtmp://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94 RTMPS: rtmps://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94

      • stopStreamRtp

      • switchCamera

        public void switchCamera()
                  throws CameraOpenException
        Switch camera used. Can be called on preview or while stream, ignored with preview off.
        Throws:
        CameraOpenException - If the other camera doesn't support same resolution.
